main event: A stationary object was detected on ground radar in Clover, Vermont, on 16 August 1956.
interesting points: The object was not picked up on air-intercept radar., It hovered for about 40-45 minutes before disappearing from radar., A ground-radar operator detected the object but could not visually confirm it., There were no photos present in the report, only sketches and written descriptions., The object was described as a bright light about the size of a fist at arm's length, bluish-white in color.
sighted object: a stationary object detected by ground radar
witness description: A retired teacher and former high school principal.
